bookinfo.title: pisg 0.73 documentation
bookinfo.subtitle: How to install and configure pisg

chapter.title: What is pisg?
chapter.para: pisg is an IRC statistics generator. It takes IRC logfiles and turns them into nice looking stats.

In general, you would do something like this to get it running:
Enable logging in an IRC bot, or in your IRC client. The log will be outputted into a file.
You set up pisg, you define the channel name, and the path to the logfile you created.
You run pisg, pisg runs the log through and create statistics, it then creates an HTML page which you can upload to a webserver.

sect1.title: What are the requirements to run pisg?

listitem.para: An IRC client or bot where pisg supports the output logfile.

Any operating system which Perl runs on, this includes popular OSes such as Linux, FreeBSD, Windows and Mac. You will have a hard time finding an OS where Perl isn't supported. For Windows this means that you need to download ActivePerl.
Optional - a system to host the statistics page 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
Optional - a system to log the channel, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

chapter.title: Setting up pisg for the first time
chapter.para: Most configuration happens through the pisg.cfg file, the file format is made to be easy to read, and easy to extend for further use. It uses an XML-like format, with elements and attributes.

sect1.title: Setting up a channel
sect1.para:
An element called is made for defining channels, a quick example of a channel is here:
<channel="#channel"> Logfile = "channel.log" Format = "mIRC" Maintainer = "John" OutputFile = "mychan.html" </channel>
The above will define a called #channel, the logfile pisg will look for is called channel.log and the of the logfile will be mIRC. The (which will be stated on the output page) is John.
That is basically it! Now, there are a lot more options that you can use for your channels, for this please refer to the reference documentation.

Also be-aware of the fact that pisg uses various images to show the time-related bars. These images are placed in the gfx/ folder and should be placed into the same directory as your outputted HTML file.

sect1.title: Specifying user options
sect1.para:
User options are set with a simple XML-like syntax in the form:
<user nick="NICK" option="VALUE">
Remember, the nick is always required.
For example to add aliases to a nick, then you could do this:
<user nick="Joe" alias="Joe^*">
The asterisk (*) means that it will match all nicks starting with 'Joe^'. So it will add all Joe^'s to 'Joe' in the stats.
Another thing you can do is to add a picture to a user:
<user nick="Ben" pic="ben_holiday.jpg">
If you have a larger picture of the user as well, you can make the picture on the stats page link to it:
<user nick="Ben" pic="ben_holiday.jpg" bigpic="ben-big.jpg">
You can include * or ? to enable filename globbing to randomly choose one from several pictures: (see documentation for the option)
<user nick="Ben" pic="ben_*.jpg">
You can also set a user's sex. The sex setting can be "f"emale, "m"ale, or "b"ot:
<user nick="Ben" sex="m">
Also you can add links to URLs and e-mails:
<user nick="Christine" link="http://www.christine.com">
or
<user nick="Chris" link="chris@host.com">
The last thing you can do is to ignore nicks (for example bots):
<user nick="nameofbot" ignore="y">
You don't have to do all this in many lines, you could just as easily do:
<user nick="Joe" alias="Joe^away Joe^work" pic="joe.jpg" link="joe@joe.com" sex="m">
(Here the aliases are a space separated list of nicks, that also works! But * as a wildcard is smarter, although it is slower).

sect1.title: Setting global options
sect1.para:
Many times, it will be useful to set up global options, global options are set like this:
<set option="VALUE">
Any global option will be overriden by anything defined within channel elements (see )

For example, to change the background color of the stats page, you could do:
<set bgcolor="black">
You can set many options in a single set:
<set lang="DE" timeoffset="+1">
The above will set the language on the statistics page to DE (Deutsch, German) and set the time offset to +1.
All options available are mentioned in the reference documentation.

sect1.title: Ignoring links
sect1.para:
It's possible to ignore links in the "Most referenced URLs" section:
<link url="http://www.slashdot.org" ignore="y">

sect1.title: Including common settings for various channels
sect1.para:
If you have, for example, more than one channel, where the users are the same, or you don't want to maintain more than one user file, you can use the "include" setting in the main config file:
<include="/home/vetinari/pisg/users.cfg">
This will include the file /home/vetinari/pisg/users.cfg in the config at the place where the include statement is set.
Note, that you can NOT include a file from an included file!

sect1.title: Changing the layout of your stats page
sect1.para: The standard layout and colors in the outputted HTML page are made to be somewhat clean and neutral. But you have the chance to change the layout yourself.

There are a few predefined color schemes for you to use, use the option when using them. The colorschemes distributed with pisg are: default (which is the default), darkgalaxy, darkred, justgrey, ocean, orange_grey, pisg, softgreen.

When changing it, you need a fair knowledge of CSS (Cascading Style Sheets). CSS is what most of the web uses today to define styles and layout on HTML pages. With the pisg distribution, look in the layout directory. In it resides default.css which is the file being included onto the HTML page. Open it in a text editor like vi or notepad. Then change it until you're happy with it. Be aware that you might want to look at the HiCell and HiCell2 options through pisg.cfg for changing the last two colors.
If you have created a nice stylesheet which other can take advantage of, you are encouraged to send it to the pisg mailing list so that it can be distributed with the next version of pisg.
If you want to embed the statistics into another page, use the "none" color scheme. Pisg will then omit the HTML header and write only the body part.

sect1.title: Running pisg
sect1.para: When everything is set up in the pisg configuration file (pisg.cfg), then you simply run pisg on the command-line.

Using Linux, BSD or another UNIX-like system:
user@host:pisg-0.37$ ./pisg

Using Windows:
c:\pisg> perl pisg
The program will run and parse the logfiles you specified in the configuration file.
If you are using Linux, BSD or another UNIX-like system and want run pisg automatically several times a day, then see the crontab file in the scripts/ directory.
For Windows, see the windows-upload-ftp.txt file with the pisg distribution, this file is also placed in the scripts/ directory.

sect1.title: Obtaining help and reporting bugs
sect1.para: If your problem could not be resolved through here, then you should send an e-mail to the pisg mailing list. You can subscribe and see more info at http://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/pisg-general.
If you believe that you have found a bug, you should use the SourceForge bug tracking system.

refnamediv.refpurpose: define channel name

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Channel is used in two contexts, globally when using <set> and when defining new channels. It sets the name of the channel.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: Unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: the logfile format

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Format is used to define the format of the logfile, pisg supports a various number of different logfiles, see the FORMATS file included with the pisg distribution. If your logfiles have the suffix .gz or .bz2, they will automatically be decompressed and read by pisg. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: Unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: the IRC network of the channel

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Network is used to set the network which the channel resides on, this name is displayed on the stats page.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: SomeIRCNetwork

refnamediv.refpurpose: name of the generated HTML page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OutputFile is used to define the name of the generated statistics page.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: index.html

refnamediv.refpurpose: tag to insert into OutputFile

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
OutputTag specifies a string that will replace occurrences of "%t" in . This option is most useful when used as a command line switch (-t) to pisg in conjunction with (-nf). Example:
$ pisg -co pisg.conf $ pisg -co pisg.conf -nf 8 -t -week
Leaving out the OutputTag settings from the above pisg.conf snippet, this writes both the full statistics (mychan.html) and statistics for the last week (mychan-week.html) using the same pisg config file. (Assuming that there are separate logfiles for each day.)

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: name of logfile to parse

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This defines the filename of the logfile to parse for the channel. If you want to parse a directory full of logfiles, you should use the option instead. Providing this option multiple times will parse multiple files in the order the statements appear. Wildcards (* ? []) will be expanded. See also and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: parse a directory full of logs

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When LogDir is defined to valid path to a directory, then pisg will run through that directory, parse all logfiles in it and create one HTML page from it. Useful with for example eggdrop logs. Providing this option multiple times will parse all the files in multiple directories in the order the statements appear. See also , , and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: parse only the last files in

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When NFiles is set to a positive integer, pisg will process only the last that much logfiles from and options. Useful to create statistics that cover the last week or month (assuming there are separate logfile per day/week/etc.).

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (process all files)

refnamediv.refpurpose: name of the maintainer

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Maintainer is used to define the name of the maintainer of the statistics page, this can be either the person generating the stats or the bot/client doing the logging. The maintainer is displayed in the outputted stats page. This setting is also used by some log parsers where "You" is used instead of the nick in the log (e.g. "You have been kicked"). See also , .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: MAINTAINER

refnamediv.refpurpose: use a different color scheme for stats page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ColorScheme is used to define the color scheme used for the statistics page. Actually it's the CSS file being included. CSS files distributed with pisg are: darkgalaxy, darkred, default, justgrey, ocean, orange_grey, pisg, softgreen (omit the .css). The file will be included statically in the generated HTML page. If you give a file name or URL (i.e. a color scheme name with .css or a path), the file will be linked to instead. Using "none" will cause pisg to write only the body of the page; use this to include the statistics into a custom page. See also , , HiCell/HiCell2.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: default

refnamediv.refpurpose: alternate stylesheets for stats page

refsynopsisdiv.programlisting:
<channel="#channel"> Logfile = "channel.log" ColorScheme = "darkgalaxy" AltColorScheme = "layout/ocean.css" Maintainer = "John" </channel>
<set AltColorScheme="layout/darkgalaxy.css layout/justgrey.css">

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: AltColorScheme defines an alternate CSS file to be used for the statistics page. Multiple files can be given (space separated.) Note that this is not supported by all browsers. See also and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: default

refnamediv.refpurpose: define the language / translation to use

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Lang defines the language to use for the stats. Currently, lang.txt includes: EN (English), BG (Bulgarian), CA (Catalan), CZ (Czech), DA (Danish), DE (German), EE (Estonian), ES (Spanish), FI (Finnish), FR (French), GR (Greek), HE (Hebrew), HU (Hungarian), IS (Icelandic), IT (Italian), NL (Dutch), NL_BE (Flemish), NO (Norwegian), PL (Polish), PT (Portuguese), PT_BR (Portuguese/Brazil), RO (Romanian), RU (Russian), SE (Swedish), SI (Slovenian), SK (Slovak), SQ (Albanian), TR (Turkish), YU (Serbian). Output in several languages can be generated at the same time, separate the languages by comma. The tag %l in the output file name will be replaced by the language name. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: EN (English)

refnamediv.refpurpose: define a file as page header

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PageHead is used to include a file in the stats page, for example an introduction text, a link to an image or a banner. The file can hold anything, it will be included raw in the stats page - so HTML should be preferred. The file will be included in the top of the page. This option is the opposite of .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: none

refnamediv.refpurpose: define a file as page footer

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PageFoot is used to include a file in the stats page, for example an introduction text, a link to an image or a banner. The file can hold anything, it will be included raw in the stats page - so HTML should be preferred. The file will be included in the bottom of the page. This option is the opposite of .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: none

refnamediv.refpurpose: only parse logs LogPrefixed with a user defined string

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When using the option and you only want to use a slew of the files in it, you can have pisg choose only files which are prefixed with a special string.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: Regexp to sort logfiles by format month||day||year

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: LogSuffix is used to define the suffix of a logfile, it only works when is defined. The example in the synopsis is for the eggdrop bots default format.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: Unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: make pisg silent, suppress messages

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This option is useful mainly from command line when invoking pisg with --silent 1. But it can also used in the configuration file. It will suppress all standard output from pisg. Error messages will still be sent.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: use a cache to speed up log parsing

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Setting this option makes pisg dump the results of log parsing into cache files. The next time pisg is run, it compares the timestamp of the log(s) with the timestamp stored in the cache file. When the log was not changed, the cached data is used. (This means that it does not work if you only have a single big logfile. Split the log at arbitrary points and use or ="dir/*".)

Note that the cache files should be deleted when the pisg config file is changed since the cache data uses the old config settings. does not work especially well with the cache when using different settings.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: Unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: number of days to show in "Daily Actitity"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This option sets the number of days to show in the "Daily activity" section. Pisg will generate a graph that shows the actitivy during this timeframe. Setting the option to 0 disables the section.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable/disable "Most Active Times"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can disable the "Most Active Times" section on the stats page. It will simply disappear when specifying 0.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable/disable "Most Active Nicks"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can disable the "Most Active Nicks" section on the stats page.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable/disable "Big Numbers" sections

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can disable the "Big Numbers" and "Other Interesting numbers" sections on the stats page. They will simply disappear when specifying 0.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable/disable "Latest topics" sections

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can disable the "Latest topics" section on the stats page. It will simply disappear when specifying 0.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable/disable "number of lines"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The default behaviour is to add a column to the "Most Active Nicks" section displaying the number of lines a user wrote. With this option it can be disabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable/disable "words per line"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can enable the "words per line" column in the "Most Active Nicks" section. It will add a column describing the average words per line for a person.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable/disable "characters per line"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can enable the "characters per line" column in the "Most Active Nicks" section. It will add a column describing the average number of characters per line for a person.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable/disable "number of words"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The ShowWords option adds a column to the "Most Active Nicks" list which list the total number of words a user has typed.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: show when a user was last seen on a channel

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option enabled, a column will be added to the "Most Active Nicks" section to display when a user was last seen. E.g. "2 days ago".

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: show when a nick was active

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The default behaviour is to add a column to the "Most Active Nicks" section displaying a fancy time bar to show when a user was active. With this option it can be disabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: mIRCStats like behaviour of time bar

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The default behaviour is to add a column to the "Most Active Nicks" section displaying a fancy time bar to show when a user was active. With this option it can be done the same way as mIRCStats does it; that is, by putting that time bar next to the number of lines, in the same column.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: ShowLineTime like behavior of words column

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The default behaviour is to add a column to the "Most Active Nicks" section displaying a fancy time bar to show when a user was active. With this option it can be done similarly to mIRCStats does it and like the ShowLineTime option, but using words instead of lines; that is, by putting that time bar next to the number of words, in the same column.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable the random quotes

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The default behaviour is to add a column to the "Most Active Nicks" section displaying a users random quote. With this option it can be disabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable the legend of the time bars

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg shows a legend below the "Most Active Times" displaying what the different colors means. With this option it can be disabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable the kick line

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg shows an example kick line in the "Most kicked"-stats. With this option it can be disabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable the action line

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg shows an example action line in the "Most actions"-stats. With this option it can be disabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable the shout line

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg shows an example shout line in the "Most shouting people"-stats. With this option it can be disabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: set how many decimals to show

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg uses 1 decimal. With this option you could change it to whatever you like. Negative is treated as the default value.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 decimal

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable the foul line

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg doesn't show an example foul line in the "Most fouls"-stats. With this option it can be enabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable the violent lines

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg shows example violent lines in the "Most aggressive" and "Most attacked"-stats. With this option it can be disabled.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable "Most used words"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg adds an "Most used words" section to the stats page. With this option you can disable it from being shown. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable "Most referenced nicks"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg adds an "Most referenced nicks" section to the stats page. With this option you can disable it from being shown. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable "Most referenced URLs"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg adds an "Most referenced URLs" section to the stats page. With this option you can disable it from being shown. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable channel music charts

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option set, pisg creates a chart listing of the top songs played on the channel. See also and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable op statistics

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg has op statistics in the "Most interesting numbers" section. Here you can disable the feature, it's useful if you don't feel that the information is of any value, or your log format doesn't support ops/deops.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable voice statistics

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg doesn't have voice statistics like it has op statistics. Enabling this option will add a section to the "Most interesting numbers" displaying who got most voices.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: enable or disable halfop statistics

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg doesn't have halfop statistics (+h on some servers) like it has op statistics. Enabling this option will add a section to the "Most interesting numbers" displaying who gave most half-ops.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: show who changed nick most often

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By enabling this option, pisg will add a section to the stats showing who had the most nicks, and what the nicks were. This option only works properly when is enabled or user aliases have been defined. See also , , and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: show stats on which gender talked most

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Setting this option will make pisg create statistics on which gender (female/male/bot) talked most (see the "sex" option in ). See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: show most used smileys

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option, pisg will make a list of the most used smileys in the channel. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: show channel karma

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option, pisg will analyze the channel karma. Users can give other users (or things) good or bad karma by saying "nickname++" or "nickname--"; "nickname==" resets it to zero. Only the last karma is remembered per nick/nick combination, so there is at most +- 1 karma point. See also and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: show most active nicks by hour

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By enabling this option, pisg will add a section to the stats showing "Most Active Nicks By Hour" - also look at the and settings.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: only count stats for top talkers, ignore less-active users

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By enabling this option, stats in the "Big Numbers" and "Interesting Numbers" section will only be counted for users who were the most active. E.g. users who appear in the "Most Active Nicks" section, as respected by the and options. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: show graphs in most active nicks by hour

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By enabling this option and the option, pisg will show graphs in the "Most Active Nicks By Hour" section.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: ignore specified words

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Sometimes words in the "most used words" appears which you don't want to see, with this option you can ignore these words. It also applies to the "most referenced nicks" section. It's a space separated list of words. You can use * like in nick aliases. Can not be used in a channel-only context.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control random quote output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When set to "1", pisg will not output quotes containing ignored words. Pisg will output a blank line after trying 20 random quotes if all 20 random quotes were ignored.

refnamediv.refpurpose: specify words considered to be bad/FoulWords language

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: There is a section in the "Most interesting numbers" which tells who had a "dirty mouth" - here you can define which words are considered being bad/foul. It is a space separated list of words. You can use * like in nick aliases. Can not be used in a channel-only context.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: ass fuck bitch shit scheisse kacke arsch ficker ficken schlampe

refnamediv.refpurpose: specify words considered to be aggressive/violent

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: There is a section in the "Most interesting numbers" which tells who is most "aggressive" - here you can define which words are considered being "violent". It is a space separated list of words. You can use * like in nick aliases. Can not be used in a channel-only context.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: slaps beats smacks

refnamediv.refpurpose: minimum numbers of letters for a random quote

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The random quotes displayed in the "Most Active Nicks" section will be picked from a length range. With this option you can change the minimum number of letters required for a random quote. Also see the option. Note that pisg will still choose a short quote if it cannot find a longer one.

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum numbers of letters for a random quote

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The random quotes displayed in the "Most Active Nicks" section will be picked from a length range. With this option you can change the maximum number of letters required for a random quote. Also see the option.

refnamediv.refpurpose: minimum number of characters in an interesting word

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The "Most Used Words" section on the stats page display the most used words. The default is that a word only appears if it is longer than 5 characters. With this option you can change that minimum.

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum allowed length of a "word" with no spaces

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Pisg will automatically insert a space in words that have a length over the amount QuoteWidth is set to. When used in breaking up URLs it will insert a space in the displayed URL, but not in the actual URL referenced by the HREF.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Minimum number of lines per user for some "Big Numbers" statistics

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Pisg will ignore users with less than this setting lines in the "questions asked", "shouts loudest", "CAPSLOCK", "longest line", "most sad", and "most happy" sections. If the setting is "sqrt" (the default), it will be dynamically replaced with the square root of the number of lines of the most active nick. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: sqrt

refnamediv.refpurpose: nicks to show in "Most Active Nicks"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can define how many nicks you want to appear in the "Most Active Nicks" section on the stats page.

refnamediv.refpurpose: nicks to show in "These didn't make it.."

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can define how many nicks you want to appear in the "These didn't make it" section on the stats page.

refnamediv.refpurpose: number of nicks to show in "Most Active Nicks By Hour"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can define how many nicks you want to appear in the "Most Active Nicks By Hour" section on the stats page.

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum number of nicks to show in "users with most nicknames"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can define how many nicks you want to appear in the "Users with most nicknames" section. See also and .

refnamediv.refpurpose: show nicks used in "most nicks"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By disabling this option you can stop pisg from displaying all the nicks a user has had in the "Most used nicks" section. See also , , and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 1 (enabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum number of topics to show

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can define how many topics you want to appear in the "Latest topics" section.

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum number of URLs to show

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can define how many URLs you want to appear in the "Most referenced URLs" section. See also .

refnamediv.refpurpose: number of songs to show

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This option sets the number of songs that will be show in the channel music charts. See also and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 5 (the Top Five)

refnamediv.refpurpose: how to recognize songs played

refsynopsisdiv.programlisting: <channel="#channel"> Logfile = "channel.log" Format = "mIRC" ChartsRegexp = "(?:is )?(?:np:|(?:now )?playing:? |listening to:? )(?:MPEG stream from)?\s*(.*)" </channel>

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This option is a perl regexp that is used to recognize songs played. Please tell the pisg mailing list if you have a better default. The regexp MUST contain a single () pair to extract the song name. See also the perlre(1) manpage, and .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: "(?:np:|(?:now )?playing:? (?:MPEG stream from)?)\s*(.*)"

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum number of words to show

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can define how many words you want to appear in the "Most used words" section. See also .

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum number of nicks to show in "Most referenced nicks"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you can define how many nicks you want to appear in the "Most referenced nicks" section. See also .

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum number of smileys to show in smiley stats

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: At most this many smileys will appear in smiley stats. See also .

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum number of nicks to show in "Karma"

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: At most this many nicks will appear in the good and bad karma stats. See also and .

refnamediv.refpurpose: track nick changes and create aliases

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Enabling this option will track nick changes as well as it can. It will then automatically create aliases for these nicks. Useful for and other stats. Nick tracking does not work for log formats that do not use the nickname for the person running the logger, but only show "You" there. See .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: maximum number of nicks in lists

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This option trims lists of nicks to a maximum length, replacing the rest with "...". Setting to 0 disables trimming. Affected are the used nicks in the "Users with most nicknames" section, nicks in "Most active genders", and nicks in the "Good/bad karma by" columns. See , , and .

refnamediv.refpurpose: sort "most active nicks" by words

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The default for the "Most Active Nicks" section - is to sort users by lines. Enabling this will sort it by words instead.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: path to images on stats page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The location to the pictures used on the stats page - not the user pictures but the different bars in "Most Active Times".

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: Current directory

refnamediv.refpurpose: number of user pictures per row

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: UserPics allows you to configure the number of user pictures per row. Per default, one picture will be shown. Since pictures are usually higher than one line of text, this lets the table grow. With settings greater than 1, several pictures will be placed next to each other. A good setting would be UserPics=3 and pictures of size 60x60. Set UserPics to no or 0 to disable user pictures. The latter is useful if you share a user config file between channels and want to disable user pictures for some channels.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: yes (1)

refnamediv.refpurpose: path to user pictures (HTML page)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ImagePath defines the path to where user pictures are located, relative to the HTML page generated. The default is that user pictures is located in the same directory as the HTML page.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: current directory

refnamediv.refpurpose: use a default user picture

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DefaultPic defines a picture to be displayed for all users which have no other picture defined in the user element. This is good for showing "No picture available" or something. May contain globbing patterns, see below.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: path to user pictures (output generation)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ImageGlobPath defines the path to the directory where user pictures are located, relative to the current directory. This setting is used to choose random pictures if ? or * (globbing characters) are used in the picture name. ? matches a single character, * matches a (possibly empty) string. The default is the setting. (NB: This setting will be different from if the latter is not relative to the current directory, e.g. if you are writing the HTML file outside of the current directory.)

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: current setting

refnamediv.refpurpose: define a standard width for user pictures

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PicWidth defines the standard width for user pictures. Setting the 'width' attribute of image-elements on the outputted stats page. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: define a standard height for user pictures

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: PicHeight defines the standard height for user pictures. Setting the 'height' attribute of image-elements on the outputted stats page. See also .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: unset

refnamediv.refpurpose: character set to use for stats page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The pisg stats page defines a character set in a meta tag, this can be used if your country is using a different one than the default. Pisg will also use this setting to convert the language templates from if the language defines a source charset. Note: you also have to tell your webserver to transmit the charset to the browser. With Apache, use "AddDefaultCharset off" in the server config.

refnamediv.refpurpose: character set for logfiles

refsynopsisdiv.programlisting:
<channel="#channel"> Logfile = "channel.log" Format = "xchat" Charset = "iso-8859-1" LogCharset = "utf-8" </channel>
<set Charset="iso-8859-15"> <set LogCharset="iso-8859-15">

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If LogCharset is set and different from , pisg will convert the charset using Text::Iconv. Using this option slows down log processing.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: empty (no conversion)

refnamediv.refpurpose: fallback character set for logfiles

refsynopsisdiv.programlisting:
<channel="#channel"> Logfile = "channel.log" Format = "xchat" Charset = "utf-8" LogCharset = "utf-8" LogCharsetFallback = "iso-8859-1" </channel>
<set Charset="utf-8"> <set LogCharset="utf-8"> <set LogCharsetFallback="iso-8859-15">

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: LogCharsetFallback defines a fallback charset for the conversion. This is useful if you have mixed unicode/iso-8859-* logs. Pisg will first try the conversion from . If that fails, LogCharsetFallback is used. Note that this only works for charsets where certain byte sequences are illegal, like UTF-8. (In short: LogCharset = utf-8, LogCharsetFallback = iso-8859-15 works, the other way round does not.)

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: empty (no fallback conversion)

refnamediv.refpurpose: use a different time zone than the local machine

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, pisg uses the time of the local machine to display the time of the generated stats. Sometimes when you have a shell on an external box, and it's in another country, you want to use another time. This is accomplished by the TimeOffset command.

refnamediv.refpurpose: use regular expressions in user aliases

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Enabling this option will make all aliases in <user> lines be parsed as regular expressions; this setting also applies to the , , and settings.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: 0 (disabled)

refnamediv.refpurpose: filename of language file

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With this option you have an alternative way to define the name and/or path to the language file. Usually you don't have to touch this option.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: lang.txt

refnamediv.refpurpose: path to directory with CSS files

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: CssDir is used to define the paths to the CSS files (the s). Usually you don't need to change this. This setting is only used when statically including the CSS file.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: layout/ (in current directory)

refnamediv.refpurpose: colors for color gradient in most active nicks section

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: HiCell and HiCell2 define the colors to be used for the color gradient in the most active nicks section. They should match your . When setting HiCell the empty string (""), pisg will not generate a color gradient; you might want to use this with ="none" or .

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: #BABADD, #CCCCCC

refnamediv.refpurpose: type of log (not the format of the log)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The type of logs kept for your channel. Currently only "Logfile" is supported, so you don't need to change this option.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: Logfile

refnamediv.refpurpose: dump raw statistics into file

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This option is intended for debugging pisg, but might be useful to process the parsed logs with another program. The file contains the %stats and %lines hashes in perl's Data::Dumper format.

refsect1.title: Default
refsect1.para: Unset
